introduction: Exploring the reasons behind the slow performance of SELECT \* queries in a row store database engine.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding SELECT \* Queries
content: Explanation of SELECT \* queries and their impact on database performance.
Discussion on the differences between SELECT \* and specific column queries.
Explanation of how SELECT \* queries can lead to full table scans and increased network latency.
Overview of the importance of indexing and query optimization in improving query performance.

sections.title: Section 2: Full Table Scans and Page Reads
content: Explanation of how SELECT \* queries lead to full table scans and page reads.
Discussion on the limitations of fixed-size pages and their impact on database performance.
Explanation of how deserialization cost affects query performance and network latency.
Overview of how to optimize queries to reduce the number of columns and minimize deserialization costs.

sections.title: Section 3: Network Costs and Data Loss
content: Explanation of how network costs and data loss can impact query performance and user experience.
Discussion on the importance of data consistency and minimizing network latency.
Explanation of how retransmission and data recovery can affect query performance and user experience.
Overview of strategies to minimize network costs and improve data consistency in database systems.

sections.title: Section 4: Lazy Parsing and Client-Side Optimization
content: Explanation of lazy parsing and its impact on client-side performance.
Discussion on how to optimize client-side fetching and deserialization to minimize network latency and improve user experience.
Explanation of how to use client-side caching and data prefetching to further improve query performance and user experience.
Overview of best practices for client-side performance optimization in database systems.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion and Future Directions
content: Summary of the key takeaways from the discussion on SELECT \* queries and their impact on database performance.
Discussion on future directions for research and development in database systems and query optimization.
Overview of best practices for optimizing queries and improving database performance in various applications.
Call to action for further exploration and research in the field of database systems and query optimization.
